adjective.description: Lower in rank, status, or quality.
examples: schooling in inner-city areas was inferior to that in the rest of the country
ulcers located in the inferior and posterior wall of the duodenum

adjective.description: (of a letter, figure, or symbol) written or printed below the line.

noun.description: A person lower than another in rank, status, or ability.
An inferior letter, figure, or symbol.

origin: Late Middle English (in inferior (sense 2 of the adjective)): from Latin, comparative of inferus low.
